video.title: Standards, the key to choice and flexibility
video.label: See how Microsoft invests in standards for greater innovation
video.description: In some cases, standards are seen as restrictive, but in the IT industry they open the way for innovation and simplify the development process by providing a road map for technology to work across platforms. This is why Microsoft supports and embraces the ongoing creation of standards across the industry.

video.label: Industry leaders share their perspective on open source and Microsoft
video.description: SugarCRM is one of the largest developers of open source CRM software in the world. Listen to CEO Larry Augustin and other open source developers describe how Microsoft works with them to offer the best of both worlds.

video.title: Australia | Redlands School
video.label: Redlands School innovates with their Smart Online Learning System
video.description: Australia's Redlands School uses an open source learning system called Moodle. Redlands worked with Microsoft to deploy Live@Edu, giving students and staff a secure, scalable cloud-based mail service integrated with Moodle. As a result, Redlands saw cost savings as well as reduced IT overhead.

video.title: Connected Government
video.label: The Connected Government Framework reduces costs, improves service
video.description: Microsoft's Connected Government Framework is built on the idea of operability. This translates into freedom of choice in technology, as well as enhanced performance, and time and cost savings.
